name: relating to detection and solving crimes

children.name: speed camera x
children.definition: speed camera a camera at the side of the road which takes pictures of cars that are going faster than is legally allowed : máy chụp ảnh những người chạy quá tốc độ cho phép được gắn bên đường

children.name: radar trap x
children.definition: radar trap a system, using radar, which the police use to catch vehicles that are travelling too fast : hệ thống rađa để phát hiện xe chạy quá tốc độ qui định

children.name: breathalyse x
children.definition: breathalyseuk , usbreathalyzeverb kiểm tra về lượng rượu đã uống
examples: to test a driver's breath to see how much alcohol they have drunk
breathalyser, usbreathalyzernoun[ c ] trademark dụng cụ kiểm tra lượng rượu trong hơi thở
a device like a small bag with a tube at one end, which the police can ask a driver to blow into to see how much alcohol the driver has drunk

children.name: breath test x
children.definition: breath test a test in which the police ask a driver to blow into a breathalyser (= a device shaped like a bag) to show whether they have drunk too much alcohol to be allowed to drive : sự kiểm tra hơi

children.name: speed trap x
children.definition: speed trap khu vực khống chế tốc độ (của xe cộ trong thành phố)
examples: a place on a road where the police use special hidden equipment to see whether drivers are going faster than is allowed in a particular area

children.name: when the police are looking for a criminal
look for a1
children.definition: look for/ search for to look for sb who has been involved in a crime or who has escaped from prison: truy tìm, săn lùng
examples: police are still looking for three men who stole £55,000 from a post office in york.
police searching for the killer of a nine-year-old girl have appealed to the public for help.

children.name: be after sb x
children.definition: be after informal to be trying to find and catch someone who has done something wrong: truy tìm
examples: she said she was frightened because the police were after her.
the man we’re after is one of the biggest drug-dealers in south america.

children.name: hunt b2
children.definition: hunt to search for a criminal-use this whena large number of police are making an organized search over a wide area: săn tìm , să lùng
examples: hunt for
police are still hunting for the girl’s killer.
hunt sb down[search for a criminal until you find them]
many opponents of the regime who escaped abroad were later hunted down and killed.

children.name: when the police, a court etc asks sb about a crime
question b2
children.definition: question to ask sb a lot of questions to find out what they know about a crime: tra vấn
examples: they questioned her for three hours before releasing her.
question sb about sth
the lawyer questioned me about how money was transmitted to mexico.
question sb closelycarefully, asking a lot of difficult questions
after questioning the suspect closely, investigators decided he was not a part of the drug operation.
questioning[u noun] sự tra vấn
the lawyer’s questioning of the witness did not go on as long as expected.
keep/ hold sb for questioning
mr hayes is being kept at newham police station for questioning.
questioner[countable noun] thẩm tra viên
eventually his questioners realized he was not the man they wanted and let him go.

children.name: assist the police x
children.definition: assist the police with/in their inquiriescộng sự với cảnh sát trong công cuộc điều tra
examples: if sb is assisting the police with their inquiries,it usually means they have been taken to the police station to be asked questions about a crime.

children.name: interview b1
children.definition: interview toask sb questions to see if they have committed a crime : phỏng vấn
examples: interview sb about sth
the police want to interview you about the accident.
interview[c] an official meeting in which the police ask sb questions to see if they have committed a crime : phỏng vấn
a police interview

children.name: lie detector x
children.definition: lie detector (specializedpolygraph) a piece of equipment used to try to discover if someone is telling lies : máy phát hiện nói dối
examples: both men refused to take a lie detector test.

children.name: interrogate x
children.definition: interrogate to keep asking a lot of questions for a long time, sometimes using threats, in order to get information: thẩm vấn ,cật vấn
examples: the police interrogated waters for 24 hours until he confessed.
army officers have been accused of using unorthodox methods when interrogating enemy prisoners.
interrogate sb about sth
i was interrogated at length about my conversation with the two men.
interrogation/ɪnˌterəˈgeɪʃən/ [c or u noun] sự thẩm vấn
most of the information about the bombings came from the interrogation of terrorist suspects.
interrogator[c noun] người thẩm vấn
the report concludes that military interrogators routinely use torture to find out what they want.

children.name: cross-examine x
children.definition: cross-examine/cross-question  if a lawyer cross-examines or cross-questions sb in a law court, they ask them a series of questions about their previous statements in order to find out whether they have been telling the truth: thẩm vấn chéo, đối chất
examples: the first lawyer cross-examined the defendant for over three hours.
when the witness was cross-questioned, it became clear that his earlier testimony was not entirely true.
cross-examination/cross-questioning[c or u noun] sự đối chất
during/ under/ in cross-examination
under cross-examination, the psychiatrist admitted that he could not be sure of his diagnosis.

children.name: carry out door-to-door inquiries
children.definition: if the police carry out door-to-door inquiries, they go to all the houses in a particular area to ask the people living there what they know about a crime: gõ cửa từng nhà
examples: police are carrying out door-to-door inquiries on the hazelwood estate.

children.name: be helping police with their inquiries x
children.definition: be helping police with their inquiries to be formally being asked questions by the police about a crime - used especially in news reports about someone who the police think is guilty of a crime but who has not been officially charged: giúp cảnh sát điều tra
examples: ▪ a man is helping police with their inquiries after a mother and her young baby were found dead at their home last night.

children.name: to secretly watch a person or place
spy on sb c2
children.definition: spy on sb to watch sb secretly, in order to find out information about them:do thám
examples: mathers admitted he had followed ms evans and spied on her.

children.name: watch a1
children.definition: watch
examples: the thieves had obviously been watching his house and knew when he was likely to be out.
he had the feeling that he was being watched.
watch sb’s movementswatch someone as they go to different places
detectives have been watching mr heskey’s movements for some time.

children.name: keep a watch on u
children.definition: keep a watch on if the police keep a watch on a person or place, a group of them are organized to watch that person or place continuously:
examples: our orders were to keep a 24-hour watch on the cottage where the men were staying.

children.name: surveillance x
children.definition: surveillance when people, especially the police or government officials secretly watch a place or person, especially for a long period, often using special equipment such as hidden cameras:
examples: television surveillance in public areas should help to make housing developments safer.
surveillance camera
banks are installing surveillance cameras to prevent robberies.
under surveillancebeing secretly watched
the men had been under surveillance by customs officers for some time before their arrest.
keep sb/sth under surveillance[secretly watch sb or sth]
the terrorists had been kept under constant surveillance by our officers.

children.name: observation b2
children.definition: observation when people watch a place or person carefully for a period of time:
examples: under observationbeing watched
a patrol car spotted us and the officers inside made it clear that we were under observation.
keep sb/sth under observation[watch someone or something]
we want that place kept under constant observation.

children.name: raid c2
children.definition: raid if the police raid a place, they arrive there suddenly to look for criminals, drugs, or stolen goods: xét nhà
examples: the casino nightclub has been closed since it was raided last month.
police officers raided a house in north london last night, and found substantial quantities of illegal drugs.
raid[c noun] [c2] a sudden visit by the police to a building in order to look for criminals, drugs, stolen goods etc:cuộc lục soát, săn lùng bất ngờ, cuộc vây bắt, cuộc ruồng bố
raids are almost a nightly occurrence at this club.
raid on
seven people were injured in last night’s police raid on a house in brixton, south london.

children.name: frisk x
children.definition: frisk/frɪsk/  if the police, airport officials etc frisk sb, they feel the person’s clothes and body, looking for hidden weapons or drugs: dò soát, lục soát
examples: a guard frisked him expertly, then led him into a large room.
be frisked
we were stopped by the police and frisked before being allowed into the building.
frisk sb for sth
they pulled me aside and frisked me for weapons.

children.name: strip search x
children.definition: strip search to make sb remove their clothes in order to check their body for hidden drugs or weapons: cởi đồ khám xét ai
examples: we cannot open every piece of baggage and strip search every passenger on every flight.
hicks was taken to the police station, strip searched, and put in a holding cell.
strip search[c noun]
are strip searches legal?

children.name: detection x
children.definition: detection when the police discover information about crimes : phát hiện
examples: a low/highcrimedetection rate

children.name: reward b1
children.definition: reward an amount of money given to sb who helps the police or who helps to return stolen property to its owner : tiền thưởng
examples: the police offered a rewardof$10.000forany information about the robbery.

children.name: reconstruction c2
children.definition: reconstruction an attempt to get a complete description of an event using the information available, or an attempt to repeat what happened during the event : diễn lại, dựng lại (hành vi phạm tội)
examples: a dramatized reconstruction of the robbery was shown on television to try to make people remember any vital pieces of information that would help the police.

children.name: case b2
children.definition: case a problem, a series of events or a person being dealt with by police, doctors, lawyers, etc. : vụ án
examples: several social workers have looked into the child's case.
the detectiveonthe case (= responsible for solving it) has been suspended from duty.

children.name: criminology x
children.definition: criminology the scientific study of crime and criminals : khoa tội phạm, tội phạm học
examples: criminologist[c noun] someone who studies crime and criminals : nhà tội phạm học

children.name: tracker dog x
children.definition: tracker dog a dog specially trained to help the police find people they are looking for, using their sense of smell : chó nghiệp vụ (chó dùng để lần theo dấu vết bọn tội phạm..)
examples: the body was found after an extensive search by police with tracker dogs.
sniffer dog[c noun] [mainly uk informal] chó trinh thám
a dog that is trained and used by the police or army to find hidden drugs or bombs by smelling them

children.name: identity parade x
children.definition: identity parade /lineup  a row of people, including a person who is believed to have committed a crime, who are shown to awitness(= person who saw the crime) to find out whether the witness recognises that person : hàng người được cảnh sát đưa ra để nhân chứng nhận diện kẻ phạm tội

children.name: rogues' gallery x
children.definition: rogues' gallery a collection of photographs of criminals kept by the police : ảnh tội phạm để nhân chứng nhận dạng
examples: [figurative]he occupies a prominent position in the rogues' gallery of the financial world.
